tuv.seg: All proposals for new laws (in other words, Acts of the Oireachtas) start life as Bills
Tosaíonn gach togra le haghaidh dlíthe nua (nó Achtanna an Oireachtais i bhfocail eile) mar Bhillí
Proposals for laws that apply to the general public are called Public Bills which include Government Bills and Private Members’ Bills
Tugtar Billí Poiblí ar thograí le haghaidh dlíthe a bhaineann leis an bpobal i gcoitinne lena n-áirítear Billí Rialtais agus Billí na mBall Príobháideach
Proposals for laws that are promoted by corporate entities or individuals for their own purposes are called Private Bills
Tugtar Billí Príobháideacha ar thograí le haghaidh dlíthe a chuireann aonán corparáideach nó duine aonair ar thograí le haghaidh dlíthe a bhaineann leis an bpobal i gcoitinne
In general, Private Bills are very rare
Is annamh a bhíonn Billí Príobháideacha ann de ghnáth
A Private Member's Bill is a Public Bill that can be initiated by any member of either of the houses of the Oireachtas (that is, the Dáil or Seanad), regardless of their political affiliation
Is Billí Poibli iad Billí na mBall Príobháideach agus is féidir le aon bhall den Dáil nó den Seanad Bille a chuir ós cómhair an Tí is cuma cén páirtí lena mbaineann siad
The Private Member's Bill cannot be started by any member of the Government, Minister of State, the Attorney General or leader of the House in the Seanad
Ní féidir le aon bhall den Rialtas, le Aire Stáit, leis an Ard Aighne ná le ceannaire an tí sa Seanad Bille Baill Phríobháideach a thosú
Like Government legislation the Private Member's Bill must be passed by both Houses of the Oireachtas
Díreach mar is gá do Reachtú an Rialtais go nglacfaí leo i dTithe an Oireachtais, is gá do Bhille Baill Príobháideach go nglacfaí leis, freisin
In practice, the Government opposes Private Members' Bills so it is very rare that a Bill will survive to become legislation
Sa ghnáthbhealach cuireann an Rialtas in aghaidh gach Bille Baill Príobháideach agus is annamh a éiríonn leo dul tríd chun a bheith i ndlí
Sometimes, Private Members' Bills are initiated by members of the Oireachtas simply to draw attention to an issue or to focus public debate on a gap in the law
Uaireanta tugtar Bille Baill Phríobháideach ós cómhair na Dála nó an tSeanaid chun aird a tharraingt ar cheist phoiblí nó chun díospóireacht a thosnú ar locht éigin atá sa dlí
Read more about Bills and how legislation is initiated and debated
Is féidir leat tuilleadh eolais a fháil faoi conas a dhéantar reachtaíocht a thionscnamh agus a chaibidliú
